class createcloth.verbesserer.strickalterator(oldgraph_nodeattributes, oldgraph_edges_with_label, newgraph_nodeattributes, newgraph_edges_with_label, startpoint, oldgraph_identificationpath, oldgraph_nodeinfoonpath, logging_information=None)¶
create_replace_info(graph_nodeattributes, source_edges, startnode)¶
Raises

WrongStartnode, FindError

classmethod from_graph_difference(nodeattributes1, edges1, nodeattributes2, edges2, startnode_old, starttranslation)¶

function to generate an ersetzer through differences in two graphs the ersetzer cahces only the border of the different parts and the difference itself

for example 0-a-b-c-d-1 -> 0-a-e-d-1

-difference: b-c and e

-border: a and d

-not in ersetzer contained: 0 and 1

startnode can only be node on the border for algorithm see sourcecode

Writes in alterator.logging_information:

‘oldgraph_translator’: used translator for oldgraph to savednodes ‘newgraph_translator’: used translator for newgraph to savednodes

eg.use oldgraph_translator to identify nodes to add (cls.nodes_to_add())

Parameters

  • oldgraph – subgraphs must be comparable to subgraphs of asd2 means ‘asd.subgraph(.. ) == asd2.subgraph(.. )’ must be working correctly

  • newgraph – the target graph, see also asd

  • startnode_old – id of node in asd, :param edgeattribute: string of name of the edgeattribute which is followed

  • nodeattributes – list of nodeattributes which to look for

  • starttranslation – Starttranslation if startnodes may be part of the unshared nodes of both graphs, Optional

Aype starttranslation

Dict[ Hashable, Hashable ]

Return type

verbesserer

classmethod from_manuals(manual_old, manual_new, stitchinfo, start_at='bottomleft', manual_type='machine', startside='right', startpoint_method='marked', reverse=False)¶

generates everything i need for replacing a subgraph

Parameters

  • startpoint_method – keyword for finding the startpoint for replacement

  • nodes_to_consider (none, networkx.graph or list) – state which nodes should be searched for, when replacing a subgraph. if none equals automated

  • manual_old – the graph where the subgraph is to be searched for

  • manual_new – the target graph

  • start_at (str) – string to determine which node should be starting node for the search later in the replacement possible options are given by: find_startpoint_dictionary.keys() extra options can be added, see find_startpoint_dictionary

replace_in_graph(graph, startnode)¶

Tries for startnode all available builtin alterater.

Parameters

  • graph (networkx.Graph) – Graph to be alterated

  • startnode (Hashable) – Marked node in graph as startpoint for alterator

Returns

Return if successful
